title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at HCA Houston Healthcare Clear Lake (Houston, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the StaRN Residency! Was then Interviewed by 2 RN Managers for the unit. Very friendly and positive experience. The managers were respectful and truly interested in what I had to offer the team. Have been to a few interviews with different organizations and this is by far the most positive experience I've had. They offered me the job later that day and I gladly accepted.
Interview Questions: Interview Tips: Be yourself, lots of behavioral questions. They want to see that you have a passion  for care. Be open-minded and make it a priority that you display your dedication and value for leadership, as this leads to better patient outcomes.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview

Interview Questions: If you were giving.a blood transfusion and the patient started having an itchy throat and flushing red, what would you do?

title: StaRN Residency Interview

title: StaRN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HCA Houston Healthcare Clear Lake (Webster, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was a panel interview with about 7-9 nurses holding different positions from different units (nurse managers, charge nurses, etc). Units during my interview included IMCU, SICU, CV 1 and 2, oncology, Bariatrics, stroke med/surg, medical/cardiac, and some others. They each had the files I've submitted before, so bringing along your own resume is not needed, in fact, they will let you know to send it off to HR if you bring anything. They certainly can tell you the layout of the program if you ask specific questions.
The interview lasted about 25 minutes for me. Questions and answers were thrown across the room from both sides, and every nurse in there were very kind and receptive. Taking notes are a plus, and an even better impression.
Interview Questions:
1)What are your fears about becoming a new graduate nurse?
2) Can you work nights?
3) Have you had clinicals in Clear Lake, and if so, which units?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at HCA Houston Healthcare Clear Lake in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and received a call from HR the next morning. Set up appoint for early into the next week. Came to HR first as instructed. HR walked me to the office of my interviewer and began introductions. Left me with the interviewer. Felt welcomed. Made me feel at ease. I was introduced to the therapy staff in the office. Everybody was polite and welcoming. Interviewer told me she would leave me with the therapy team for a few minutes so they could ask me questions and get to know me. Everyone was so friendly and asked me questions about my experiences. They had a copy of my resume when I walked in so they already had an idea. I was asked questions about me personally. Questions like do you have a family? Where do you live? Everyone there seemed very happy working there. A lot of them have been there 10 or more years. They described there work life as "family centered".  Everyone looks out for each other and helps each other out. They made a lasting impression on me. Great group of folks!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at HCA Houston Healthcare Clear Lake (Webster, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: So I applied for this job over 3 months ago before they finally called me for an interview, they claimed they didn't know how my information got to them, hmm.. application maybe? lol. Anyways I accepted an interview, even though it was rejected immediately when I applied online (yeah the HR people aren't medically trained, but they apparently reject apps before the medical supervisors get to look at them). So the supervisor pushed it through anyways, then once I arrived; apparently you are treated like a child, someone has to practically hold your hand the whole way to your interview (hey we're adults, treat us like adults mmk?), but I never made it that far, I came dressed in a real expensive and nice dressy jean (silver brand) and a dockers brand long sleeved dress shirt with dockers dress shoes. Well later she came out (after I sat for almost 30 minutes, even though they say arrive 15 mins early (and i'm the unprofessional one?). Well to continue, she said I wasn't dressed appropriately and that they had to cancel the interview due to those circumstances. I would like to note that every job I have ever landed I dressed that way, actually the only job I didn't land was a big corporate sales job and I dressed in a very expensive suit which I returned the next day because I don't wear suits, they're very uncomfortable and I ain't bill gates lol. Nonetheless be prepared to "froo froo up" if you apply here, they think they're a big corporate hospital like christus or memorial, but at the end of the day they're still "hca".
Interview Questions: N/A
